result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew L. Cover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mathew L. Cover is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mathew L. Cover was found guilty of Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Mathew L. Cover was found guilty of Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew L. Cover in court with attorney Troy L. Nielsen.  Defendant Matthew L. Cover in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:52
Calling 15cm232 and 14cf88(set for SEHR)
Plea questionnaire filed- No contest plea to  15cm232   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Miclig/Neilsen/Court statement to sentencing on both cases

15cm232- Court WHS and POP For 2 years-
CC/CV/Supervision fees/DNAAS/Submit DNA sample-  -Any conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

14cf88 - Court sentences to 6 months  each count CC -Credit for 77 days -  Huber for all purposes - any unpaid costs reduced to a judgment 
Appeal rights given 
In regards to unpaid fines- defendant to serve time out - may run CC with current sentence -
Adj. 11:12 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 08-26-2015 10:30 am

10:55 a.m. Defendant Mathew L. Cover in court, in custody, with attorney James Donald McKenzie. Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Schiek speaks to agreement. State moves to amend Cts. 1 & 2 to s. 948.09 misdemeanor and dismiss Ct. 3. Court grants motions to amend Cts. 1 & 2 and dismiss Ct. 3. Counsel recommend defendant not required to register according to s. 973.048(1m)(a). Defendant pleads no contest to amended Cts. 1 & 2. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Schiek--victim rights compliance/McKenzie statement to sentencing. Court statement--does not require defendant registration under 973.048(1m)(a). Court quashes Writ.

Court sentence - Ct. 1
WHS
2 yrs. POP consecutive to Oneida Co. Case 11CF189
CC/CV/Supervision fees
DNA surcharge
Appeal rights given

Ct. 2 - concurrent w/Ct. 1
WHS
2 yrs. POP
CC/CV/Supervision

14FO444, 09FO1393, 11CM225, 11CM229 - Court orders jail time for each upaid amount and grants credit for time already in custody.

03:34 pm - Defendant Matthew L. Cover in court with attorney James Donald McKenzie, appearing telephonically with leave of the court.  Defendant Matthew L. Cover in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  McKenzie in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Matthew L. Cover in court with attorney James D McKenzie.  Defendant Matthew L. Cover in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Detective Joshua Chimulura, sworn, direct by Michlig; cross by McKenzie.  Witness identifies Defendant.  Court finds based on testimony that probable cause exists and binds over for further proceedings.   Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

02:59 pm - Defendant Matthew L. Cover in court, via video,  with attorney James D McKenzie.  Defendant Matthew L. Cover in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 09fo1393, 11cm225 and 11cm229 (RH).  In 14cf88 - McKenzie in receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for prelim.  Concerning the outstanding fines - Court sets over to track with 14cf88.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 23, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

01:23 pm - Defendant Matthew L. Cover in court, via video, in custody.  Michael W Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.    In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
